name: Alba Orbital
headline: We make satellites to image everywhere on Earth, every 15 minutes
description: Alba Orbital is building the world's largest earth observation constellation, imaging everywhere on earth, every 15 minutes. We can see events within minutes such as wildfires in real time and have signed >$85m of LOIs, with both government and commercial customers paying pre-orders for imagery. To date we have launched 41 satellites into orbit (more than any other seed stage company in history), with more launching in 2024 onwards. We have launched a number of technology demonstration imaging satellites called Unicorns, which are the world's most advanced satellite under 1kg ever flown in orbit.
generated_description:
**Alba Orbital: Pioneering Access to Earth Imaging and Satellite Technology**

Founded as part of Y Combinator's W21 batch, Alba Orbital is on a mission to democratize access to space. Situated in Glasgow, UK, this innovative company is building the largest Earth observation constellation, aiming to capture images of the entire planet every 15 minutes. Imagine being able to monitor wildfires in real time—this is becoming a reality through their satellite technology.

Alba Orbital has managed to launch a total of 41 satellites into orbit, marking a significant milestone as the leader among seed-stage companies. Their advanced satellites, notably the Unicorns (the most sophisticated satellites weighing under 1 kg), pave the way for heightened capabilities in space missions, with more launches slated for 2024 and beyond.

With over $85 million in Letters of Intent (LOIs) from government and commercial sectors, it's clear that there’s robust demand for their imaging capabilities. Their offerings include:

- **Night Lights**: High-resolution night imagery of Earth.
- **Alba Launch**: A budget-friendly option for launching satellites, starting at 25,000 Euros.
- **Unicorn-2 Platform**: A platform that allows for bespoke in-space missions with pico-satellites.
- **Alba Connect**: Managed ground station solutions for satellite communications. 

Notable clientele includes prestigious institutions like the European Space Agency (ESA), Stanford University, and TU Delft, underscoring their credibility in the industry. 

With a dedicated team of 16 employees and Brad Flora as their Group Partner, Alba Orbital is well-equipped to lead the charge in affordable and frequent space imagery. The future looks bright, and if you’re curious about their journey or want to learn more, visit their website [Alba Orbital](https://www.albaorbital.com). 

In short, Alba Orbital isn't just a satellite company; it's a transformative force making space accessible, insightful, and actionable for everyone.
